Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type B1 kantharos with trace of handle attachment; discoloured white slip, glaze fired orange-brown; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed below; on left, part of lotus flower in added white outline; exterior: brown line on edge of rim, reserved below with painted inscription.
Curator's comments: 'A917' is written in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd. Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds above two white bands on the interior (Williams 1983, 169). Many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim, and they have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 169, no. 156, pl. 34, no. 12)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 728, no. 883)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1825) (phase 2)
